segments.en: Linked Discourses 16
1. Kassapa
12. The Realized One After Death

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā ca mahākassapo āyasmā ca sāriputto bārāṇasiyaṃ viharanti isipatane migadāye.
segments.en: At one time Venerable Mahākassapa and Venerable Sāriputta were staying near Benares, in the deer park at Isipatana.

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā sāriputto sāyanhasamayaṃ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito yenāyasmā mahākassapo tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā mahākassapena saddhiṃ sammodi.
segments.en: Then in the late afternoon, Venerable Sāriputta came out of retreat, went to Venerable Mahākassapa, and exchanged greetings with him.

segments.pli: Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā sāriputto āyasmantaṃ mahākassapaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side and said to Mahākassapa:

segments.pli: “kiṃ nu kho, āvuso kassapa, hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā”ti?
segments.en: “Reverend Kassapa, does a Realized One exist after death?”
“Reverend, this has not been declared by the Buddha.”

segments.pli: “Kiṃ panāvuso, na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā”ti?
segments.en: “Well then, does a Realized One not exist after death?”
“This too has not been declared by the Buddha.”

segments.pli: “Kiṃ nu kho, āvuso, hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā”ti?
segments.en: “Well then, does a Realized One both exist and not exist after death?”
“This too has not been declared by the Buddha.”

segments.pli: ‘hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’”ti.
“Kiṃ panāvuso, neva hoti, na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā”ti?
segments.en: “Well then, does a Realized One neither exist nor not exist after death?”
“This too has not been declared by the Buddha.”

segments.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’”ti.

segments.en: “And why has this not been declared by the Buddha?”

segments.pli: “Na hetaṃ, āvuso, atthasaṃhitaṃ nādibrahmacariyakaṃ na nibbidāya na virāgāya na nirodhāya na upasamāya na abhiññāya na sambodhāya na nibbānāya saṃvattati.
segments.en: “Because it’s not beneficial or relevant to the fundamentals of the spiritual life. It doesn’t lead to disillusionment, dispassion, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.
That’s why it has not been declared by the Buddha.”
“So what now has been declared by the Buddha?”
“‘This is suffering’ has been declared by the Buddha.
‘This is the origin of suffering’ …
‘This is the cessation of suffering’ …
‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’ has been declared by the Buddha.”
“And why has this been declared by the Buddha?”

segments.pli: “Etañhi, āvuso, atthasaṃhitaṃ etaṃ ādibrahmacariyakaṃ etaṃ nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṃvattati.
segments.en: “Because it’s beneficial and relevant to the fundamentals of the spiritual life. It leads to disillusionment, dispassion, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.
That’s why it has been declared by the Buddha.”
